text: Booker T. & the M.G.'s are a rhythm and blues (R&B;) band that are important in the history of soul music. They started in 1960 when they played instrumental music for singers. They did not sing themselves. They worked at Stax Records, and played music on hundreds of important records by famous singers such as Wilson Pickett, Otis Redding, Bill Withers, Sam & Dave, Carla Thomas and Rufus Thomas and Johnnie Taylor. They also make their own records. As they do not sing, these are instrumental records - music without singing. In 1962 they made a record called "Green Onions" which was a single, and this was a success.Association with Stax http://www.discogs.com/artist/Booker+T+&+The+MG's People liked the sound of their music, and by the mid-1960s, bands in America and in Great Britain were trying to copy their sound.Booker T & MGs prominent in 60s-70s http://www.history-of-rock.com/booker_t_and_the_mgs.htm "Ronnie Lane Interview #1, The-Faces.com" http://www.the-faces.com/lane/1LaneMain.htm People liked them so much and felt they were so important they were given an award of being named in the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 1992. ==Persons in the band== Persons in the band when they started in 1960 were Booker T. Jones (organ and piano), Steve Cropper (electric guitar), Lewie Steinberg (bass guitar), and Al Jackson, Jr. (drums). Steinberg left the band in 1965, and Donald "Duck" Dunn joined the band. Since Al Jackson, Jr. was murdered in 1975, the band have used several drummers.Members of the group through the years http://www.history-of-rock.com/booker_t_and_the_mgs.htm ==References== Category:American R&B; bands Category:Musical groups from Tennessee Category:Musical groups established in 1962 Category:1962 establishments in the United States Category:Atlantic Records artists
